physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pupils round and reactive to light; optic-disk margins sharp; visual fields normal; neck supple; remainder of physical and neurologic examination normal.
Bilateral optic-disk edema and splinter hemorrhages observed during ophthalmologic evaluation. Bilateral blurred optic-disk margins during emergency department examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening papilledema identified, with further visual field defects observed during follow-up examinations.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral optic-disk edema; neurologic examination normal; normal complete blood count and serum electrolyte levels. Neurologic examination showed transient numbness in groin and sensory loss but resolved.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: During hospital admission, visual and neurological symptoms developed with new findings of papilledema.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal opening pressure of cerebrospinal fluid; decreased sensation in sacral nerve areas on examination after lumbar puncture.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased opening pressure noted on subsequent lumbar puncture, further revealing CSF analysis consistent with elevated intracranial pressure.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Worsening papilledema observed; constriction of the inferior nasal visual field detected.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Chronic papilledema with significant visual-field defects noted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI showing marked expansion of optic-nerve sheaths bilaterally and kinking of optic nerves.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms consistent with increased intracranial pressure noted on imaging.
